column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////The appetizers by themselves already stood out. The gyozas were steaming hot
column4: but a tad bit small. The fried chicken bites were just as fresh and juicy. And then came the ramen
column5: and the 2047502745 toppings you could add to it
column6: including FRIED ONIONS. but even the fried onions couldn't be compared to the noodles. I cannot emphasis enough on how satisfying the thick noodles were. Soft but yet SO bouncy
column7: soaking in a broth that had a perfect amount of flavor and not too salty or creamy. The chashu was so tender and the egg yolk still runny. Hands down by far the best bowl of ramen I've had in Houston.
